item.title: [Delta++]A Ranking System - Inspired by MW2 - Easy to Convert
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

iz3 legend:

Constants should have the ‘final’ modifier and be accessed only in static context. I’d recommend rethinking some of the naming. Also consider converting your long ‘if - else’ chains into a switch statement.

switch eh? Alright man.

Read full topic

@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

item.title: [Delta++]A Ranking System - Inspired by MW2 - Easy to Convert
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

The tutorials weren’t actually ranked, they were just listed, lol (there was no “#1”). At least that’s what Flame_ told me when he was making it.

[quote=“xxxtilllyxxx, post:15, topic:519818”]Wtf, this isn’t even close to being a #1 tutorial…[/quote]It’s all relative the month, there weren’t that many submitted anyways. So being in the top 3 out of 5 or 10 isn’t THAT crazy.

item.title: [Delta++]A Ranking System - Inspired by MW2 - Easy to Convert
item.dc:creator: @blackflag1 blackflag_
item.description:
@blackflag1 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:9, topic:519818”][quote author=Int Bauk link=topic=638314.msg4303222#msg4303222 date=1369340858]
instead of that final constant class, you should have made it abstract then moved the methods to the other class.

and i don’t like this: if (RankNames.Private.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Private.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Private.toString(); else if (RankNames.Private_First_Class.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Private_First_Class.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Private_First_Class.toString(); else if (RankNames.Specialist.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Specialist.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Specialist.toString(); else if (RankNames.Corporal.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Corporal.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Corporal.toString(); else if (RankNames.Sergeant.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Sergeant.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Sergeant.toString(); else if (RankNames.Staff_Sergeant.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Staff_Sergeant.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Staff_Sergeant.toString(); else if (RankNames.Sergeant_First_Class.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Sergeant_First_Class.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Sergeant_First_Class.toString(); else if (RankNames.Master_Sergeant.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Master_Sergeant.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Master_Sergeant.toString(); else if (RankNames.First_Sergeant.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.First_Sergeant.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.First_Sergeant.toString(); else if (RankNames.Sergeant_Major.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Sergeant_Major.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Sergeant_Major.toString(); else if (RankNames.Command_Sergeant_Major.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Command_Sergeant_Major.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Command_Sergeant_Major.toString(); else if (RankNames.TWOnd_Lieutenant.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.TWOnd_Lieutenant.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.TWOnd_Lieutenant.toString(); else if (RankNames.ONEst_Lieutenant.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.ONEst_Lieutenant.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.ONEst_Lieutenant.toString(); else if (RankNames.Captain.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Captain.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Captain.toString(); else if (RankNames.Major.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Major.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Major.toString(); else if (RankNames.Lieutenant_Colonel.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Lieutenant_Colonel.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Lieutenant_Colonel.toString(); else if (RankNames.Colonel.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Colonel.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Colonel.toString(); else if (RankNames.Brigadier_General.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Brigadier_General.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Brigadier_General.toString(); else if (RankNames.Major_General.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Major_General.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Major_General.toString(); else if (RankNames.Lieutenant_General.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.Lieutenant_General.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.Lieutenant_General.toString(); else if (RankNames.General.expRequired1 <= exp && RankNames.General.expRequired2 >= exp) rank = RankNames.General.toString(); else if (RankNames.Commander.expRequired1 <= exp) rank = RankNames.Commander.toString(); else if (exp < RankNames.Private.expRequired1) return ""; return rank.replaceAll("_", " ").replaceAll("ONE", "1") .replaceAll("TWO", "2");

gj.
[/quote]
Can you please tell me how that big, if-else statement String could be improved? I was sitting there blank on ideas to improve it. And yes, I already tried a for statement.[/quote]

i’m working on a weird ranking system as well

but in your case, here’s an example

Getting a rank name:

public String getRankName(){ return player.getGang().getRank().toString(); }
something like that?

    public enum GangRank {

        THEIF(0),
        GANGSTER(50);

        private int requiredLevel;

        private GangRank(int requiredLevel) {
            this.requiredLevel = requiredLevel;
        }

        public int getRequiredLevel() {
            return requiredLevel;
        }

        public GangRank getNextRank() {
            switch (this) {
                case THEIF:
                    return GANGSTER;
                case GANGSTER:
                    return ETC...;
            }
            return null;
        }
    }

Promoting/ranking up

    public void handlePromotion(Client killer) {
        if (killer.getExpLevel() >= getRank().getNextRank().requiredLevel) {
            setRank(getRank().getNextRank());
            //send message congratulations 
        }
    }

hope this gives you an idea, you could really shorten this system

Read full topic
